job_title: Customer Care Specialist I in Appleton, WI
pros: Navitus is an AMAZING company! From day 1 I felt like everyobe at Navitus had my back, training is excellent and the supervisors, product managers, everyone is great. There is never a dull day. Work is remote, though there is an option to work in the office. Insurance benefits is top notch especially if you have a have a family. The biggest thing I can say about Navitus is the leadership really care about their people. Navitus is one great big family and it really shows!
cons: Tbh Navitus is great, the only con I can think of is their system could be a little faster. But honestly it's not a big and deal and most of the time there is no issue.

job_title: Sr. Business Intelligence Developer in Madison, WI

review_title: Best Company I've Ever Worked For!
pros: My team works so well together and truly respects one another. My manager cares deeply about the employees that work here as well as me as their direct report; takes an interest in my personal life and makes a point to always ask how I'm doing (with work and outside of it). The company makes decisions ethically and always asks the question "how will this decision/change affect our employees?". The benefits are the BEST I have ever seen at any company. I am challenged in my position and my talents are utilized. I can see myself here long term!
cons: None, I love it here!

review_title: Good company, but doesn't know how to grow
pros: Great atmosphere, and a quickly growing company. Great people to work with.
cons: Very slow to hire, especially in the IT space which is sorely needed. currently LOTS of turnover. Could use some profits to keep current employees rather than lose them. Pay leaves a bit to be desired, hence the turnover. Many people have left for similar positions with higher pay at other companies.

job_title: Accumulator Claims Extract Analyst in Appleton, WI

The people are amazing!
The training is very well thought out and sufficient.
The Remote access is wonderful.
The Benefits are top notch.
The hours are perfect.
cons:
They do not use their platforms to the best of their ability.
Their processes could be more efficient.

pros: The culture is much friendlier than in my experiences at larger organizations. A few bad leaders, like most places but, overall leadership is supportive and shows they care. Senior leaders much more in touch. A lot of growth going on and with it some growing pains, but for all the right reasons. Great work-life balance - sometimes have to work extra hours, but not an ongoing expectation. Everyone participates in the bonus program, including hourly. Very flexible in work location (in office, flex, and work from home).
cons: Not yet big enough to reduce difficulties in finding good talent.

review_title: Too Much Growth with No Staff

cons: in the midst of staffing struggles they took on so much additional work and low/mid level employees have paid the cost. Folks in critical roles leaving so there's so much more work for the rest of us. PTO allowance could be better.

job_title: Business Analyst in Green Bay, WI
pros: Excellent manager, work from home.
cons: I don't really have any cons.

pros: great premiums, copays OOPs and MOOPs on your health insurance
cons: This department is so badly managed. There are 2 managers for each section. One manager takes care of the workers and the other manager manages that manager. However any time you do anything both managers from each section (and sometimes even more) must be involved even though they sit around in meetings all day and are NEVER available. Everyone must start at the lowest level despite previous experience. You are given a huge variety of work so it is difficult to become good at any of it. Processes change constantly so just when you think you know how to do something the process changes. Once you finally move to the next level they change you to salary and force you to work OT. You have to document your work in at least 3 different programs so sometimes it takes longer to document the work than to do it. They thrive on negativity and discipline. Most meetings regarding a new process will end in them telling you that you will be fired if you don't comply. You will never get a promotion. They say they are growing and there is plenty of room for advancement but it just isn't happening. They have stopped giving bonuses to hourly employees. I would love to move on once life is back to normal. Take my advice and stay away.

pros: Wonderfully friendly coworkers and a gorgeous office.
cons: promotion can be extremely hard to achieve if you are looking to move up.

job_title: Customer Care Specialist in Oshkosh, WI

cons: Not really sure yet but I'll update

pros: Great benefits and fairly flexible hours
cons: More supervisors and managers than actual employees. Why do you need a director, manager, and two supervisors for a department of 15 people. People are power hungry and things are very political. HR does nothing about complaints.

pros: great benefits and 401K package
cons: Not proactive with the vision and direction with here they want to go. All actions are very reactive which causes burnout.

review_title: Very good company to work for

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Oshkosh, WI

pros: Great Benefits, Flexible working hours, Remote work, great culture

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist in Appleton, WI
pros:
Nice building
Cafeteria 
Mostly pleasant co-workers
New cubicles
Free lunch every-so-often
The actual "work" was enjoyable.
Insurance
Vacation
Pay
cons:
To get into Navitus you have to use a temp agency (at least for prior authorization), often they will let the contracted/required staffing agency hours pass so you won't get their benefits right away- they generally use Aerotek or Total Med, (Use Total Med, they get hired faster).  

They are secretive about benefits (even if directly asking), they will not discuss them unless hired or an employee divulges. 

401K 5% match 
Vacation days 20 (earn 2 per month)
YOU WILL work rotating holidays and weekends (open 365 days/yr)
You can't choose your shift hours, new hires work 11-8:30p 
Health/Dental Insurance

Pay:  
Commercial/Private Insurance: $15/hr ($1 extra for  10-6:30 or later shift)
Medicare part D side $15.25/ $16.25 ($1 extra later shift)

Can only use break time to use the bathroom. 
You'll often be too busy to take all breaks or work though break.

Work on a tattle-tale mentality,  mistakes are sent as "learning ops" to supervisors then emailed to all  (name redacted).

Work is audited.

Limited advancement opportunities

You'll get conflicting answers about how to do things then penalized if wrong.

Most communication is through email (easily 100+ per day).

Management not transparent, if they have a problem with you they won't tell you or approach you about it.  

They call the temp agency and terminate your contract without warning (they did this to 3 people in my hiring "group".

Management/employee cliques

review_title: One of the Best Companies I've worked at
job_title: Senior Network Engineer in Appleton, WI
pros: Great work life balance, staff all very friendly almost like a family environment.
cons: Workload flows from low to high but not sure what can be done about that, part of the type of work and the fact they are a growing company.

pros:
Great leadership and Co-workers
Good work life balance
Never feel too overwhelmed or lost
cons: None really, pay could be a little higher but that's like that everywhere

review_title: Don't let the uptake in positive reviews fool you
pros: The new building in Madison is nice
cons:
Navitus HR actually sent out an email to their employees saying there were too many negative reviews, and to please write reviews. Instead of fixing the problems that actually exist (favoritism, poor compensation, lack of advancement opportunities, not "best in class" benefits, to name a few) they are actually asking employees to do them a solid, and in my opinion fluff their rating. These negative reviews are not "sour grapes" from previous employees. These are real issues plaguing this company. There are many companies growing at a rapid pace, similar to Navitus, who are handling their business and their staff much better. Even little things like better bereavement, maternity/paternity leaves, wellness programs and true merit increases could help.

Bullying also seems to be tolerated here, many times causing staff to feel as though they are working in a middle school environment. Even with direct documented complaints to leadership, bullies are allowed to exist and even advance.

job_title: Customer Service Representative III in Appleton, WI
pros: Great atmosphere and culture, more than a number, rewarded for hard work, quickly growing company, lots of room for advancement
cons: Playing catchup with telework capabilities

pros: Excellent benefits!! Hard to beat.
cons: Not so great pay compared to competition but they make up for it with culture.

job_title: Customer Service Agent in Oshkosh, WI
pros: benefits are good and pay is good
cons: staff are mean girls basically

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist in Appleton, WI
pros: Culture, benefits and the people
cons: Working weekends every now and then

review_title: Lots of good but the bad can be detrimental
pros: Competitive pay, good health benefits and 401k, good bonus, nice clean working environment (new buildings!), the company is growing, flexible schedule, jeans every day.
cons: Small minded management, lots of cliques, unwillingness to adapt to new processes (it is the way it is because it's always been that way).  It's time for some of the executive management (and a few Directors) to move on.  People promote based on friendships and not qualifications which then results in a big divide between management and the employees.

job_title: Associate Medicare Services Executive in Appleton, WI
pros: The Navitus Business model is "for" the consumer.  Very refreshing by today's standards.  The work environment is more than ideal.  The benefits are 2nd to none.  The willingness and effort made by long term employees to educate and support the new-comers is amazing.  Very easy-going laidback feel.  Everyone here is very knowledgeable and dedicated to the produce the high quality product that Navitus provides.
cons: None so far.  I'm too excited to get to work here.

review_title: More unhappy employees than happy ones. Don’t work in the call center unless you enjoy feeling belittled and useless.
pros:
Benefits are amazing
You do get quite a bit of free food and stuff 
They do have “fun events” to relieve stress
Get to watch the highway action if you are lucky enough to sit by the window on the right side of the building
cons:
Company is taking on more clients than the call center can handle making the work environment for everyone stressful and unbearable.
Basically no chance to move up as either an in house or remote agent unless you are connected with the right people.
Constant negativity and micromanaging makes you feel useless and unwanted.
The “fun events” they do, take people off the phones and cause numbers to drop which in turns leads to the you need to do better emails from management..

review_title: Plenty of Opportunity, Some Growing Pains
pros: Navitus has been steadily growing, and that means promotion opportunities.  They offer employees an annual bonus, annual raise (every year) as well as profit-sharing. The insurance is pretty good, and the company chips in quite a bit toward my premiums (even as an agent).  There are lots of women in roles of leadership throughout the company - all the way up to the VP level, which is encouraging.  Four campuses (two in WI, one in AZ, and one in TX) allows for some movement if needed.
cons: Because Navitus is growing at a rapid rate, it has caused some growing pains - largely that management/HR are often stuck trying to marry the small business ideals we started with to the realities of operating a large business.  This can lead to some veteran employee confusion/dissatisfaction.

review_title: The Navitus Culture is Second to None!
pros: I've been working at Navitus for almost 10 years and it's really the culture that makes me stay. Great people, excellent benefits, and I learn something new every day. I enjoy the challenges that come with working at a quickly growing PBM. I can stand by the Navitus Mission, feeling good about what it is we do every day. I feel appreciated as an employee and have referred numerous people to work here as well. I have the freedom to do what I need to do to get the job done while also bringing my creative ideas to the table. Navitus is a great place to work!
cons: The Human Resources Department is not always supportive/timely and can sometimes create unnecessary obstacles for leadership.

review_title: Growing exponentially with exceptional room for advancement.
pros: Senior management is filled with hard working professionals who yearn to succeed. The company is growing at an exponential rate so hard work is not only expected, but is critical, making internal promotion commonplace. Excellent benefits.
cons: Human Resources does not provide the support and services that they should. Some favoritism within departments which is expected in the corporate world. Rapid growth resulting in extended hours.

review_title: It's time for some people to retire
pros: Great health benefits and work/life balance. The bonuses are nice. The facility is nice but working in a cubicle can get annoying. My co-workers are awesome!
cons:
Promotions seem to be based off of tenure and not skills/knowledge
Little to no career advancement opportunities for most
Most departments have no budget for training/educating staff
HR can be difficult to work with

pros:
On-Site Café
Friendly Coworkers
Fair Compensation
Lots of Free Food
cons:
Poor Organizational Structure
Too Many "Leaders"
Poor Distribution of Workloads

review_title: Exceptional Culture - Employees as important as Clients here.  Growing pains, yes...but very team driven.
pros: Many cultural teams for wellness, activities, charitable giving, recognition, leadership development here.  We work hard, and share in the rewards.  People come here, and stay--low turnover due to team orientation, great benefits package, and competitive salaries.  Employee satisfaction rates consistently in the 90th percentile.
cons: Growing quickly, as a fairly young company does not always have fully-defined roles.  Therefore, people frequently wear many hats and work outside their comfort zone...but that's what makes us grow personally and professionally.

job_title: Customer Care Specialist in Austin, TX
pros: This company goes above and beyond to service it's customers with it's motto being 100% transparency. They also do a great job of creating a balanced work culture for their employees. I have never worked for an employer that cared about their employees and making sure they have everything necessary to succeed like this before. Prime example, I find it extraordinary that my Supervisor on a daily basis makes sure he goes around to everyone's cubicle and speaks just to see how your days is going!
cons: If I had to point out one con it would be compensation. Although the pay is good, for the job that we do and compared to other similar customer service reps the pay could be more.

review_title: Amazing place to work and grow
job_title: Prior Authorization Operations Auditor in Appleton, WI
pros: I have been with navitus 5 years now and started from the bottom and worked my way up. I have always been recognized for my hard work and dedication. I love my coworkers and supervisors. The pay is good, benefits are great, pto is great, and extras like bonuses and free food is amazing. I've worked in call center, prior authorizations I and III and now auditor scoring and combing through episodes on the daily. I absolutely love my job and cannot say enough good things about navitus.
cons: You are busy. I like being busy however.

review_title: Poor Management is hard to ignore
pros: Amazing benefits and bonus structure. Pay is okay, but the great benefits outweigh the lower market value for positions. Nice clean, new building. They take the time to do little events for the company like cookies on St. Patrick's Day or things like that. There are a lot of talented, kind, and intelligent employees.
cons:
Executive Management pretends to value change and growth, but when faced with thinking like a growing company, they always go back to their small company mindset. They tend to promote people based on cliquish behaviors or simply because people have been at their position for a long period of time and are now out of their pay range bracket, instead of being based on skills. 

In addition, their CIO is very out of touch with today's world as far as how IT should be managed. There is a lot of micromanagement there and they tend to promote others with those same tendencies. In addition, there is a lot of "My way or the Highway" talk when it comes to projects or requested changes.

Instead of examining their very manual and inefficient business processes they just hire more people and build bigger buildings. Having their own systems in house, and both a development and project management team devoted to them, should offer every opportunity to learn and implement agile software development. However, the executives seem to be afraid of being efficient and do not support growth or standardization of project management and business analysis framework and methodology. 

The project management prioritization is horrible. There is no sustainable long term strategy to tie projects to in order to be able to properly prioritize them based on value to the company.  Instead, projects are prioritized more by, what another reviewer called, anecdotal stories or gut feelings. When there are 10-15 high level strategies for a year with about 200 bullets/projects underneath, no one know what is truly important or what the true strategic plan is, and they definitely don't know how they can contribute to it and make it successful.

pros: 4 weeks PTO, cafeteria on site, overall relaxed environment, management is enjoyable
cons: Navitus will hire any Junior developer to write code. The solid devs are underpaid/underappreciated and have to attempt to transform the weaker devs to be self sufficient. Navitus just needs to get rid of the weaker devs and keep the people who care enough to put in the time to learn and get better. The quality of the some of the teams' software is pathetic and management is not aware of who the weak players are.

pros: Every company has their ups and downs, however Navitus has far more ups than downs.  The people are wonderful, you laugh and smile every day. Your work is challenging to keep you going, but not to challenging to make you want to give up. Most leadership (always some bad apples) actually care about you and are there for you and your ideas.  Yes, ideas... they always want to hear new ideas!
cons: As in any office setting there is a big of rumors/gossip that goes on. Consistency tends to lack across the whole company.

review_title: Amazing Culture - Great Benefits - Caring Company
job_title: Manager, Claim Adjudication Eligibility in Appleton, WI
pros: I've worked at Navitus for 12 years and am extremely happy to have them as my employer. This company recognizes and rewards hard work, encourages its employees to share and implement innovative ideas, and truly cares about its employees. The culture is family like and very positive. Management is wonderful with encouragement, communication, and empowerment of team members. I am proud to tell anyone I work for Navitus as their transparent approach to doing business with its customers aligns closely with my own values. I highly recommend Navitus as a great place to work.
cons: No cons to list at this time.

review_title: Incredible Environment, Premium Benefits, Awesome People
pros: An ethical company intent on doing the right thing for its customers and providing a good work/life balance for employees, providing a comfortable work environment, which includes amenities such as an affordable cafeteria and a gym with private showers. Navitus is growing and opportunities continue to arise - It truly believes in a good work/life balance. Best of all, the people here are not only kind but they care. The benefits are amazing. Exciting place to be!
cons: The only con is not really a con- the company continues to grow its employee engagement opportunities, even though folks here are pretty happy!

review_title: Great Company Overall, Each Department Has Its Issues
job_title: Clinical Account Executive in Phoenix, AZ
pros: The company is an ethical, transparent PBM. Great sense of community among members of my team. Benefits/401k/PTO are very nice.
cons: Overworked and underpaid. My current salary is 15k less than the exact same job at competitor PBMs. This company is very reactive and won't make decisions until stuff hits the fan. Overall the company is hesitant to accept employee feedback and suggestions to implement.

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist in Appleton, WI
pros: Nice building, lots of PTO, great health insurance benefits.
cons: You have to record bathroom breaks. Extreme micromanagement throughout the company. The supervisors behave like high school bullies. 40% of employees are in customer service/production yet Navitus ignores these people. Most in these departments work from 10am - 6:30pm or later so many amenities are inaccessible to them. The cafeteria closes before our lunch break, and company outings take place before these shifts end.

pros:
Excellent benefits.  The health insurance is second to none. 
The facility is beautiful very well maintained.  
Availability to a free workout facility.  
Management that is approachable.  
Management that encourages you to work towards your goals.  
Opportunity to earn certifications in the industry.
cons: The company needs strong proficient workers in each area to maintain the goals they have set forth. This can feel like opportunity for advancement is not always available. The wages are lower but the benefits are better.

review_title: Good place to work., but HR is kind of stuck in the past
job_title: Associate Product Manager in Appleton, WI
pros:
-Great atmosphere and culture.
-Good benefits.
-Transparent Company in an overall shady industry.
cons:
-Dated Work from Home and Telework Policies (employees are discouraged from working remotely, and even have to sacrifice a week of PTO if they work from home)
-Perks tend to be more of a discount, so employees still have to pay to take advantage of them (Many unused perks).

job_title: Senior Client Services Executive in Madison, WI
pros: Navitus has an excellent work culture and great people. The job is rewarding and offers a diversity of learning opportunities on a daily basis. The responsibilities are challenging, but the teamwork to solve problems and provide customer care are outstanding. The benefits are good and management understands the work-life balance. Integrity and transparency are core values at Navitus and that is apparent in the way the company is managed.
cons: Compensation is below that of a similar role and level of responsibility at a competitor or related company in the market.

review_title: Great Culture, Benefits and Work/Life Balance!
pros:
+Beautiful new building with lots of windows. 
+Large Atrium along with a full-service café that serves a delicious variety of breakfast and lunch options.
+Great benefits such as immediate PTO accrual, annual bonuses, low health insurance deductibles and company provided holiday meals and celebrations.
+Management really cares about you as a person and helps you succeed and grow in your career.
+Nearly everyone I pass when walking around the building has a smile on their face and are very friendly and happy to be here.
+About 6 months post-hire, I was going through a very difficult time in my personal life and needed to take a bit of time away from work to get through it.  In all of the companies I have worked in the past, I have NEVER experienced such genuine kindness, compassion and support like that in which I received from my manager and coworkers here at Navitus.
 +Fantastic Education & Training program which has offered me many opportunities for personal and career growth as well as a better understanding of the many moving parts of the business and the industry.
cons:
-It takes a while to understand the industry, but you are guaranteed to learn something new every day!
-It took me three tries over the course of 5 years to get my foot in the door here, but the third time around, they reached out to me for an interview. 
-Many positions have very specific requirements/licensures due to the complexity of the industry, which can make it difficult to be considered if you do not have the right experience or a degree; but once you are in the door, the opportunities are endless!

pros: Navitus is an amazing company to work for. The team atmosphere and amazing people are by far the best part. Being part of a growing company where your contributions are literally making a difference and creating a stronger company... the sense of accomplishment is incredible. Benefits and working conditions/spaces are excellent and diversity is celebrated. So glad that I jumped and can now call Navitus home.
cons: Everything has been a far upgrade from my previous employer!

pros: Generous with employee retirement plans, nice facilities, most people mean well. Company is true to its mission statement.
cons: Lots of new titles and promotions for male employees. Not so many for women. Poor communication among departments. Employees putting in minimal effort are tolerated and at times provided advancement opportunities.

pros:
I have been working at Navitus for 16+ years.  I love the team/family atmosphere.  You have great benefits such as health, dental, 401K, flex spending. You are able to grow your career here. You feel appreciated for the work you do and you can feel great about the work you do because Navitus stands by their mission and vision.  
Navitus is a growing company with lots of opportunities.
cons: Some growing pains, but growing is good

review_title: Growing faster than they can keep up
job_title: Pharmacy Customer Care in Appleton, WI
pros: I enjoyed learning about medication coverages; some people there were great.  Phone calls were pretty easy - most of the time.
cons: Mgmt picks on people who bring experience to the table; jealous/untrusting.  Growing too fast into areas they have no experience in.

job_title: Member Service Specialist in Appleton, WI
pros: The culture within the business is amazing, and they make you really feel like you're at home. There is advancement opportunities everywhere you look.
cons: The only real con of working here is that the lunches are unpaid at least for right now,  and the bathrooms are so far away.

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist Temp in Appleton, WI
pros:
-Good, consistent schedule
-Nice new facility
cons: -Having to be a temp employee for four months before the opportunity to be hired on

job_title: Clinical Prior Authorization Pharmacist in Madison, WI
pros: Great benefits, profit sharing, PTO. Is less stress than being a retail pharmacist. Fewer nights, weekends, and holidays than most pharmacist jobs.
cons: Poor management, treated like a number, encouraged to do more work and less quality, retaliation when you have concerns or problems you’d like to address. Also paid about 10k less than a PA pharmacist at all other PBMs.

pros: Growing company with Great Benefits. I like it that we are growing but it holds small business feeling like we are family and not just a number. Also beautiful building.
cons: Some of the original people that have been here since the beginning need to let other people in. We have great ideas and we need to be able to share them. Some favoritism takes place but that is at every company.

pros: I have worked at numerous  other entities, and this company has been a great place to work.  It has an incredible group of employees, a great culture, and it really works to make a difference in health care, and genuinely cares about its employees.
cons: Management sometimes gets in its own way while trying to always make the right decisions.

pros:
Excellent 401 k, includes profit sharing. 
Very low medical deductible. 
Friendly staff
cons: Member Services plays favorites with promotions, which are not based off seniority/experience. There is no accountability for someone's actions. Members of leadership do not listen to what the team needs/wants, they will also put you down in an unprofessional manner.

review_title: Best Job I have Ever Had
job_title: Customer Care Specialist in Appleton, WI
pros: The people I work with are all AMAZING, you are guaranteed 40 hours a week, great medical benefits as well as many many perks just for doing a job you are already being paid for.
cons: Some people do not realize how well they have it and then they complain. They clearly have never worked retail and are ungreatful for all the good the company does for us.

job_title: Customer Care Representative in Appleton, WI
pros: Work-life balance, work two holidays on a rotating basis a year, work one weekend every 6 weeks, excellent PTO, feel appreciated.
cons: Not much communication from direct supervisor, could use more feedback. It is too good of a job and want to make sure you are doing things correctly.

job_title: Customer Care Representative in Appleton, WI
pros: PTO, health insurance, location of office
cons: Favoritism,  advancement only if you hang out with coworkers after work, micromanaged on every call, too many clients, seniority is only for vacations not advancement, only people that praise navitus are the people that get promotions, non competitive pay

pros: Beautiful new buildings, most employees including executive staff are caring and  hard working. Benefits and PTO better than most companies offer.
cons: Compensation is below industry and those who complain loudest seem to get promoted. Senior HR's demeaning attitude, unethical comments, and lack of accountability cause staff to avoid them.

pros: nice building and the company is making money every year
cons: The same cons have existed since I started working there years ago.  Every year the most common complaint is favoritism and that complaint is completely dismissed in our yearly feedback meetings with utterly lame and nonsensical excuses.  I've been there a number of years and watched 1 person hired after me with less skill and experience be promoted 4 times in 5 years while I've been promoted 1 time.  I've never worked anywhere else in my career where a person gets promoted 4 times in 5 years...you'd have to be a total amazing once-in-a-lifetime superstar on the likes of Steve Jobs or Bill Gates to warrant that kind of career growth while so many others just stagnate in their current positions.  My reviews have been excellent every year with no negative feedback given but have gotten just 1 promotion.  That is favoritism in action but management continues to just deny it's happening.  Similarly 1 of my direct coworkers has been promoted 3 times in 5 years and the person is totally useless...I work with him/her every day so nobody is more qualified to make that judgement than I am.  But somehow, foolishly, management feels they know more than everyone else and can make decisions on who is deserving and who isn't, despite having no feedback program in place and despite sitting in mundane meetings 90% of the day.

pros: The company offers generous benefits and opportunities for employees to pursue different roles. A growing company with an expanding footprint. It's core business model as a true transparent benefit manager that tries to live to that everyday.
cons: Prior to the current covid-19 situation, remote work possibilities.

pros: The actual work was enjoyable, but that was it. When I was finished working there it was a relief.
cons: Management based decisions off politics and cliques as mentioned by another reviewer. No room for growth. New ideas were shot down quickly by management if they didn't come up with the idea. Trainers would give incorrect information on a daily bases. Temps are lied to about how many hours they will have to work.

review_title: I want to love working here but just lacking compared to other organizations.
pros: Parking and accesibilty from beltline is easy. There's a nice restaurant on the first floor. Some people are friendly and helpful and nice office decor.
cons: Limited training and guidance with difficult expectations due to lack of staffing. The benefits aren't as appealing as other organizations and the culture isn't one conducive to productivity.

pros: Navitus is a great place to work. Our corporate leadership focuses on clients and employees as a priority -  with that focus, follows our financial success. Most companies have that equation backwards.
cons: No major cons.  In my 8+ years at Navitus, I see and Experience great teamwork across the company.

pros: Excellent benefits, fabulous HR team, pay is fine
cons: No work/life balance, management is very cliquey, very micromanaged, pay is just fine

pros: I personally enjoy the culture of Navitus, the work-life balance is amazing compared to previous jobs. I have no issues with my management or department, co workers are amazing. PTO and Benefits are wonderful
cons: Takes some getting used to, I still am trying to learn the basic verbiage and I have been here a few years.

pros: Hours are good and somewhat flexible. Physical work environment is clean and quiet. Benefits are decent
